title: Abridgment of increased voltages for synchronous machines
abstract: The appreciable increase in the rating of generators, generating stations, and interconnected systems has resulted in large currents to be handled by generators, circuit breakers, reactors, cables, and station bus structures. This paper covers a discussion of the limitations on large generators and generating equipment by the present standard voltages of generation, the necessity for increasing the values of generated voltage, and the design, manufacturing, and operating problems involved in building high-voltage turbine generators.

authors.name: C. M. Laffoon
authors.affiliation: Power Engineering Dept., Westinghouse Elec. & Mfg. Co., East Pittsburgh, Pa.
